DOC.detailed_description: Despite importance shape solid foundation health behavior early life , college student understudied population health promotion program . This study represent innovative research impact promotion healthy lifestyle among college student . The objective develop test population-based , multiple health behavior change program college student , liveWell : A Healthy Foundation Life . The multiple behavior multimedia program offer Transtheoretical Model-based ( TTM ) computer tailor feedback regular exercise , fruit vegetable consumption , effective stress management , well provide access stage-matched dynamic web portal . The TTM comprehensive model integrate ideas several different theory approach change ( hence name `` Transtheoretical '' ) explain predict individual end high-risk behavior adopt healthy one . Thirty year research consistently demonstrate change process unfolds time series stage : Precontemplation , Contemplation , Preparation , Action , Maintenance . It match specific principle process change person 's stage change guides individual change process . The TTM apply throughout world behavior smoke cessation , alcohol reduction , bully prevention , weight management , medication adherence . A primary goal Phase II grant ass effectiveness liveWell randomize trial include 1680 student 2 large university U.S. Students recruit via freshman orientation class complete follow-up assessment 6-and 12-months . Effectiveness assess compare improvement continuous outcome measure movement public health criterion behavior . This intervention offer cost-effective , science-based , easily deliverable solution improve multiple health behavior , overall health well-being , college student .
